dailyPriceChange.name: Microsoft Corporation
dailyPriceChange.news: Microsoft (MSFT) stock surged over 4% after the U.S. Air Force awarded the company a $170.4 million contract for its Cloud One program, utilizing Azure for secure cloud services through December 2028. Additionally, Microsoft unveiled Rho-alpha, a new robotics-focused AI model from its Phi family, enabling vision-language-action capabilities for complex robot tasks with tactile sensing and human feedback learning. Shares traded at $469.43, up 4.05%, amid neutral RSI and bearish MACD, with key resistance at $489.50 and support at $465.00.

dailyPriceChange.name: Sandisk Corporation
dailyPriceChange.news: SanDisk Corporation's stock dropped as part of a broader pullback following a remarkable rally that saw shares surge over 1,200% since January 2025. The decline is primarily attributed to profit-taking and stretched valuations, rather than any negative shift in the company's strong fundamentals. The underlying demand for AI-driven memory remains a significant tailwind for the company, but technical indicators suggested the stock was overbought and due for a correction.

dailyPriceChange.name: Applied Optoelectronics, Inc.
dailyPriceChange.news: Applied Optoelectronics Inc. (AAOI) stock plummeted approximately 18% in after-hours trading following its Q3 2025 earnings release on November 7, 2025, primarily due to revenue of $118.63 million missing analyst expectations of $122.17 million, despite non-GAAP EPS loss of $0.09 aligning with estimates. The revenue shortfall overshadowed the company's bottom-line control and strong year-over-year growth, triggering investor disappointment amid high expectations. This drop added to recent negative performance, highlighting market sensitivity to top-line misses in the fiber-optic networking sector.
